com.igormaznitsa.prol.logic.triggers
Interface ProlTrigger

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractProlTrigger, ProlTriggerGoal
public interface ProlTrigger

Interface describes a trigger which will be notified about assert/retract operations for predicates distinguished by their signatures

Author:
Igor Maznitsa (igor.maznitsa@igormaznitsa.com)

Method Summary
 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ProlTriggerType> getSignatures()
          Get the map containing signatures and triggered events of target predicates for the trigger
 void onContextHalting(ProlContext context)
          The function will be called only once when a prol context (where the trigger has been registered one or more times), is halting (the halted state already set on the context so it is not possible to process goals)
 void onTriggerEvent(TriggerEvent event)
          The funnction will be called when the context fidn out that there is inside assert or retract operation over a predicate mapped on the trigger
 

Method Detail

getSignatures

java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ProlTriggerType> getSignatures()
Get the map containing signatures and triggered events of target predicates for the trigger

Returns:
a map contains signatures and associated event types, must not be null
See Also:
ProlTriggerType

onTriggerEvent

void onTriggerEvent(TriggerEvent event)
                    throws java.lang.InterruptedException
The funnction will be called when the context fidn out that there is inside assert or retract operation over a predicate mapped on the trigger

Parameters:
event - the event object describes the operation over the predicate, must not be null
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - it will be thrown if handling is interrupted

onContextHalting

void onContextHalting(ProlContext context)
The function will be called only once when a prol context (where the trigger has been registered one or more times), is halting (the halted state already set on the context so it is not possible to process goals)

Parameters:
context - the signaler , must not be null
